bibl.title: Letter from Austin Smith to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952

div1.p: Smith informs Hench that a representative from the American Medical Association will attend the Camp Lazear dedication and present a wreath.

div1.head: Letter from Austin Smith to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952
div1.opener:
EDITOR
AUSTIN SMITH, M.D.
ASSOCIATE EDITORS
JOHNSON F. HAMMOND, M.D.
GEORGE HALPERIN, M.D.
The Journal of the
American Medical Association
535 North Dearborn Street
Chicago 10
November 24, 1952
Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
After I received the carbon copy of your recent
correspondence concerning the festivities in Cuba in
December, I took the matter up with Dr. George F. Lull,
who arranged for a representative to attend the ceremonies
on behalf of the American Medical Association and present
a wreath.

Unfortunately, neither Dr. Lull nor I can be
there; in fact, practically all of the officers of the
American Medical Association will be in Denver at this
time attending the Clinical Session of the A.M.A.
